column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Kenyan government and opposition agree on power sharing
#Text=Thursday , February 28 , 2008
#Text=The heads of the government and opposition in Kenya have signed a power sharing agreement aimed at ending the crisis over December 's disputed elections .
#Text=The agreement was reached after a day of talks mediated by former United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan and the Chairman of the African Union Jakaya Kikwete .
#Text=Kenyan President Mwai Kibaki and opposition leader Raila Odinga signed the agreement before international diplomats and representatives of the Kenyan government and opposition .
#Text=Chief mediator Kofi Annan said that the two leaders had agreed on a government structure after five hours of intensive talks .

#Text=" I am pleased to be able to tell you and all the citizens of Kenya that the two parties this afternoon completed the work on agenda item three , how to overcome the political crisis , " he said .
#Text=The two sides agreed to the creation of the posts of prime minister and two deputy prime ministers .
#Text=The prime minister is accorded authority over the ministries .
#Text=The prime minister is to be nominated by the largest party or coalition in parliament and can only be removed by a majority vote of the national assembly .
#Text=The accord also calls for distribution of the ministerial posts according to the relative strength of each party in parliament .
#Text=And it calls for the changes to be enacted by constitutional amendment , a major demand of the opposition .
#Text=The Prime Minister post has gone to Odinga .
#Text=Mr. Kibaki and Mr. Odinga pledged to ensure that the accord is implemented and called for unity among all Kenyans .
#Text=Mr. Annan commended the two parties , saying they reached a common position for the good of the nation .
#Text=And he had a message for the citizens of Kenya .
#Text=" Compromise was necessary for the survival of this country , " he said .
#Text=" Support this agreement , for it is the key to the unity of Kenya .

column1: #Text=" Kenya 's leaders have reached a power-sharing agreement that represents a triumph for peace and diplomacy , and a renunciation of the violence that has scarred a country of such enormous potential .

#Text=Brown also noted that  Real leadership , patience and tolerance is necessary to ensure that the agreement sticks . "

column1: #Text=Kenyans are viewing the deal skeptically , such as 56-year old refugee Paul Waweru , " The deal between Raila and Kibaki will help to cool down the situation but I doubt if it will enable us to get back to our homes . "
#Text=Diana Murugi , 72 , lost her two sons in the violent fighting that has plagued Kenya since the end of the disputed elections at the close of last year .
#Text=" The coalition is about Kibaki , Raila and the big men , what about those of us here in the camp ?
